Does this really help? I'm not convinced that this really fixes the problem. IIRC __getattribute__ will just call __getattr__ if it doesn't find it in the __dict__ so you can still end up with this loop. A better fix would be

if 'conn' in self.__dict__:
    return getattr(self.conn, name)
raise AttributeError('no attribute: ' + name)
